head.title: Study of C⁢e intermetallic compounds: an LDA classification and hybridization effects

article.h1: Study of C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe intermetallic compounds: an LDA classification and hybridization effects

span.span: V. L. Vildosola and A. M. Llois
Departamento de Física, Comisión Nacional de Energía Atómica, Avenida Libertador 8250, 1429 Buenos Aires, Argentina

div.p: Spin-polarized calculations within the LDA approximation have been done with the goal of characterizing C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe intermetallic compounds. Symmetry and chemical environment effects on 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f hybridization and, thereafter, on magnetization effects have been studied.

In the last decades, C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe intermetallic compounds have received a lot of attention both in theory and experiment. On one side, these systems can exhibit a large variety of behaviors, such as superconductivity, huge magnetoresistance, itinerant magnetism, etc. On the other side, the nature of the 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f states is controversial since it has not been established yet which systems can be treated using a bandlike picture and which ones using a localized one. In the first picture, the effective electronic correlation is weak and the 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f states form a narrow band[1], while in the second one, the 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f electrons are highly correlated and interact weakly with the conduction band[2].

The main difference between C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe and other rare earth systems is that, in the case of Ce, the 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f state is energetically very close to the Fermi level so that its occupation number and the strength of hybridization with the conduction electron bands strongly depend on the chemical and geometrical environment. In that sense , we can understand the complexity of the phase diagram of pure metallic C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe which, depending on temperature and pressure, can be magnetic, paramagnetic or superconducting[3]. Due to this fact, different types of magnetism have been observed within the intermetallic compounds: intermediate valence behavior, Kondo effect and magnetic ordered structures (FM, AF) are among them[4]. Intermediate valence behavior appears in systems having the states with n𝑛italic-nn and n-1𝑛1italic-n ADDOP:minus NUMBER:1n-1 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f electrons almost degenerate. The nearly degenerate condition is a consequence of hybridization of the 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f states and results in a configuration with a non integer electronic occupation number n4⁢fsubscript𝑛4𝑓italic-n POSTSUBSCRIPT:start NUMBER:4 italic-f POSTSUBSCRIPT:endn_{4f}. In general, intermediate valence materials show anomalous values for some physical properties such as lattice parameter, bulk modulus, magnetic susceptibility, etc, as compared to systems with an integer 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f occupation number. The intermediate valence behavior in C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe compounds is characterized by having a very small or zero magnetic moment[5].

The different physical situations posed by these systems have been traditionally described by many body hamiltonians which consider strong electron-electron interactions and treat hybridization as a small perturbation. Kondo systems, for which correlations are dominant, have to be treated with these model hamiltonians. In C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe intermetallics, particularly, it is not clear at all how important the relative strength of hybridization and correlations are. There are systems whose electronic ground state can be well described by an itinerant picture, namely those in which 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f hybridization plays a relevant role giving rise to a decrease in correlation effects[6].

In this work our aim is twofold. First we want to use the band picture to establish a criterion for characterizing the ground state of C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe intermetallic compounds by analysing their LDA spin contribution to the magnetic moment. As a second goal, and using for this the established criterion as a tool, we also want to analyse the dependence of the magnetism of C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe on geometrical and chemical environment. For this we study a variety of C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe compounds, whose magnetic properties are experimentally well known. We claim that it is possible to determine to which regime the system under study belongs. That is, if we are dealing with strongly hybridized or strongly localized systems, going through the intermediate situations, by analysing the itinerant magnetic contribution that results from spin polarized LDA calculations. This analysis is certainly done in the knowledge that only those C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe compounds whose 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f states are essentially itinerant can be well described within the LDA band theory frame. Actually, a proper treatment for the 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f electrons would be to include the self-interaction correction (SIC)[7] in the calculations but this is not necessary for the kind of description undertaken in this work.

Once we have established our characterization tool, we discuss the relative importance of chemical and crystalline environment on hybridization and thereafter on the determination of the magnetic state of intermetallic systems of the type C⁢e⁢Xn𝐶𝑒subscript𝑋𝑛italic-C italic-e italic-X POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-n POSTSUBSCRIPT:endCeX_{n} with n𝑛italic-nn equal or larger than one.

This paper is organized as follows. In Sec. II we report the results of calculations done for several real systems and present a discussion of how the LDA approximation can be used to classify them into magnetic, intermediate valence or paramagnetic compounds. In the second part of this section we analyse the influence of chemical and structural environment on the magnetic ground state of C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe compounds. We finally present the conclusions in Sec. III.

In this work we perform ab-initio calculations using the Full Potential Linearized Augmented Plane Waves (FP-LAPW) method in the Local Density Approximation (LDA)[8]. We use the exchange and correlation potential of J.P. Perdew and Y. Wang[9]. We make both paramagnetic and spin polarized calculations. The sampling of the Brillouin zone used to calculate the electronic ground state depends on the size and symmetry of each system. In general, from 800 to 1400 k-points in the first Brillouin zone are enough for convergence. The considered muffin tin radios, Rm⁢tsubscript𝑅𝑚𝑡italic-R POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-m italic-t POSTSUBSCRIPT:endR_{mt}, are equal to 2.8 au for Ce, 2.4 au for 4⁢d4𝑑NUMBER:4 italic-d4d transition metals (TM), 2.0 au for 3⁢d3𝑑NUMBER:3 italic-d3d transition metals (TM), 1.8 au for S and 1.6 au for N. The cutoff parameter which gives the number of plane waves in the interstitial region is taken as Rm⁢t⁢Km⁢a⁢x=8subscript𝑅𝑚𝑡subscript𝐾𝑚𝑎𝑥8italic-R POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-m italic-t POSTSUBSCRIPT:end italic-K POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-m italic-a italic-x POSTSUBSCRIPT:end RELOP:equals NUMBER:8R_{mt}K_{max}=8, where Km⁢a⁢xsubscript𝐾𝑚𝑎𝑥italic-K POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-m italic-a italic-x POSTSUBSCRIPT:endK_{max} is the maximun value of the reciprocal lattice vector used in the expansion of plane waves in that zone. The total energy is converged up to 10-4⁢R⁢ysuperscript104𝑅𝑦NUMBER:10 POSTSUPERSCRIPT:start ADDOP:minus NUMBER:4 POSTSUPERSCRIPT:end italic-R italic-y10^{-4}Ry.

section.h3: II.1 Characterization of C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe compounds through their LDA magnetic moments

div.p: It is well known that C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe has one 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f electron in the solid. As we have mentioned before, the energy of this 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f state is very close to the Fermi level so that it is, in principle, very sensitive to chemical and geometrical environment. In some compounds C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe keeps its magnetic moment equal to 1 μBsubscript𝜇𝐵italic-mu POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-B POSTSUBSCRIPT:end\mu_{B} and in others it can decrease even going to zero. In this Section we establish a way of characterizing C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe compounds which allows us to classify them into magnetic, intermediate valence or paramagnetic by doing LDA spin polarized calculations. To achieve this we study compounds whose magnetic properties have already been reported and are listed in Table I.

C⁢e⁢N⁢i𝐶𝑒𝑁𝑖italic-C italic-e italic-N italic-iCeNi, C⁢e⁢R⁢h𝐶𝑒𝑅ℎitalic-C italic-e italic-R italic-hCeRh and C⁢e⁢P⁢d3𝐶𝑒𝑃subscript𝑑3italic-C italic-e italic-P italic-d POSTSUBSCRIPT:start NUMBER:3 POSTSUBSCRIPT:endCePd_{3} are accepted to be intermediate valence compounds[10] while C⁢e⁢N𝐶𝑒𝑁italic-C italic-e italic-NCeN and C⁢e⁢R⁢h3𝐶𝑒𝑅subscriptℎ3italic-C italic-e italic-R italic-h POSTSUBSCRIPT:start NUMBER:3 POSTSUBSCRIPT:endCeRh_{3} are well described by an itinerant picture[11], being paramagnetic. C⁢e⁢S𝐶𝑒𝑆italic-C italic-e italic-SCeS, C⁢e⁢P⁢d𝐶𝑒𝑃𝑑italic-C italic-e italic-P italic-dCePd, C⁢e⁢A⁢g𝐶𝑒𝐴𝑔italic-C italic-e italic-A italic-gCeAg and C⁢e⁢C⁢d𝐶𝑒𝐶𝑑italic-C italic-e italic-C italic-dCeCd are magnetically ordered systems. Table I contains the structural data and the experimental ordering temperatures, TCsubscript𝑇𝐶italic-T POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-C POSTSUBSCRIPT:endT_{C} and TNsubscript𝑇𝑁italic-T POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-N POSTSUBSCRIPT:endT_{N}, which correspond to the Curie and Neèl temperatures depending on whether the compounds are ferromagnetic or antiferromagnetic. No magnetic order has been experimentally observed for the cases where no ordering temperature is shown[12].

In our calculations three types of magnetic configurations are possible: paramagnetic (P), ferromagnetic (F) and antiferromagnetic(AF). In Table I we also list the more stable configuration and the obtained LDA magnetic moment of C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe for the different compounds. The calculations are performed at the experimental volumes shown in the same table.

The obtained magnetic moments for the compounds C⁢e⁢N⁢i𝐶𝑒𝑁𝑖italic-C italic-e italic-N italic-iCeNi, C⁢e⁢R⁢h𝐶𝑒𝑅ℎitalic-C italic-e italic-R italic-hCeRh and C⁢e⁢P⁢d3𝐶𝑒𝑃subscript𝑑3italic-C italic-e italic-P italic-d POSTSUBSCRIPT:start NUMBER:3 POSTSUBSCRIPT:endCePd_{3} are far from being 1μBsubscript𝜇𝐵italic-mu POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-B POSTSUBSCRIPT:end\mu_{B} but they are clearly not zero so that we cannot consider them as being paramagnetic. In that sense it is not surprising that these compounds are those which are widely accepted to be intermediate valence systems. An intermediate valence system is usually defined in the literature as one having in the average a non integer number of 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f electrons.

It is very important to keep in mind that LDA calculations cannot account for the strong correlation effects that may occur in some rare earth compounds. However, we can infer from their itinerant contribution and using LDA the correct ground state for the systems studied here.
Based on the comparison of experimental data and our LDA results , we propose that, depending on the LDA magnetic moment, a C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe compound can be considered as
Itinerant if μC⁢e=0subscript𝜇𝐶𝑒0italic-mu POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-C italic-e POSTSUBSCRIPT:end RELOP:equals NUMBER:0\mu_{Ce}=0,

br.p: Intermediate valence if μC⁢e<0.5⁢μBsubscript𝜇𝐶𝑒0.5subscript𝜇𝐵italic-mu POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-C italic-e POSTSUBSCRIPT:end RELOP:less-than NUMBER:0.5 italic-mu POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-B POSTSUBSCRIPT:end\mu_{Ce}<0.5\mu_{B}

Magnetic if μC⁢e>0.5⁢μBsubscript𝜇𝐶𝑒0.5subscript𝜇𝐵italic-mu POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-C italic-e POSTSUBSCRIPT:end RELOP:greater-than NUMBER:0.5 italic-mu POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-B POSTSUBSCRIPT:end\mu_{Ce}>0.5\mu_{B}.

div.p: The systems that are accepted to be itinerant, such as C⁢e⁢N𝐶𝑒𝑁italic-C italic-e italic-NCeN and C⁢e⁢R⁢h3𝐶𝑒𝑅subscriptℎ3italic-C italic-e italic-R italic-h POSTSUBSCRIPT:start NUMBER:3 POSTSUBSCRIPT:endCeRh_{3}, are the ones whose magnetic moment is exactly equal to zero. That is, when in a given C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe system the magnetic moment is zero the 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f electrons have a strong itinerant character.

In C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe compounds the degree of localization is closely related to the strength of C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe hybridization and consequently to the magnetic state. Let us take two extreme situations as examples, C⁢e⁢R⁢h3𝐶𝑒𝑅subscriptℎ3italic-C italic-e italic-R italic-h POSTSUBSCRIPT:start NUMBER:3 POSTSUBSCRIPT:endCeRh_{3} and C⁢e⁢A⁢g𝐶𝑒𝐴𝑔italic-C italic-e italic-A italic-gCeAg. In Figure 1 we show an electronic charge density plot corresponding to one of the Kohn-Sham orbitals with energy close to the Fermi level and with 90%percent90NUMBER:90 POSTFIX:percent90\% of 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f character. In the C⁢e⁢R⁢h3𝐶𝑒𝑅subscriptℎ3italic-C italic-e italic-R italic-h POSTSUBSCRIPT:start NUMBER:3 POSTSUBSCRIPT:endCeRh_{3} case, there is a mixing between R⁢h𝑅ℎitalic-R italic-hRh and C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe states near EFsubscript𝐸𝐹italic-E POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-F POSTSUBSCRIPT:endE_{F} while, this is not the case for C⁢e⁢A⁢g𝐶𝑒𝐴𝑔italic-C italic-e italic-A italic-gCeAg, as can be clearly seen in Figure 1.

We can also analyse the degree of hybridization by comparing 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f and 4⁢d4𝑑NUMBER:4 italic-d4d partial densities of states (Figure 2). The most striking difference between C⁢e⁢R⁢h3𝐶𝑒𝑅subscriptℎ3italic-C italic-e italic-R italic-h POSTSUBSCRIPT:start NUMBER:3 POSTSUBSCRIPT:endCeRh_{3} and C⁢e⁢A⁢g𝐶𝑒𝐴𝑔italic-C italic-e italic-A italic-gCeAg systems is that in the last one, the 4⁢d4𝑑NUMBER:4 italic-d4d and 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f bands are approximately 4 eV apart being both of them very narrow, of the order of 1eV, while in C⁢e⁢R⁢h3𝐶𝑒𝑅subscriptℎ3italic-C italic-e italic-R italic-h POSTSUBSCRIPT:start NUMBER:3 POSTSUBSCRIPT:endCeRh_{3}, the 4⁢d4𝑑NUMBER:4 italic-d4d band is more extended in energy (about 4eV), leading to an energy region around the Fermi level where hybridization is important. Thus, taking into account the calculated magnetic moments and using the established criterion, we say that in the compound where the 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f band is more hybridized, namely C⁢e⁢R⁢h3𝐶𝑒𝑅subscriptℎ3italic-C italic-e italic-R italic-h POSTSUBSCRIPT:start NUMBER:3 POSTSUBSCRIPT:endCeRh_{3}, the 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f band turns more delocalized leading thus to a non magnetic Ce. This should hold in general.

section.h3: II.2 Dependence of C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe magnetism on crystalline and chemical environment

div.p: C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe can completely or partially loose its magnetic moment depending on chemical and crystalline environment. In this section we study how 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f hybridization affects the C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe magnetic moment depending on the local symmetry and the chemistry of the ligand. The 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f band hybridizes not only with 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f electrons of neighboring C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe sites but also with orbitals of the ligand (4⁢d4𝑑NUMBER:4 italic-d4d, 3⁢d3𝑑NUMBER:3 italic-d3d or s⁢p𝑠𝑝italic-s italic-psp bands). Both types of hybridization produce a decrease in the magnetic moment of Ce.

For the symmetry considerations, we compare systems of the type C⁢e⁢X𝐶𝑒𝑋italic-C italic-e italic-XCeX (X=Ni, Rh, Pd) and analyse them in the CrB and CsCl crystal structures. These structures are being taken as prototypes of different symmetries within the same relative composition. Actually, both structures appear in nature associated with C⁢e⁢X𝐶𝑒𝑋italic-C italic-e italic-XCeX compounds. In general, when X is a latter TM the observed structure is CrB and when X belongs to the 1B, 2B or the 3A column of the periodic table the corresponding structure is the CsCl one.

The calculation for a given C⁢e⁢X𝐶𝑒𝑋italic-C italic-e italic-XCeX system in both the CrB and the CsCl structures helps us to understand how local symmetry affects 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f hybridization and consequently the magnetization of Ce. The calculations within the CrB structure are performed at the experimental equilibrium volume at room temperature and, since the CsCl structures are hypothetical ones for C⁢e⁢N⁢i𝐶𝑒𝑁𝑖italic-C italic-e italic-N italic-iCeNi, C⁢e⁢R⁢h𝐶𝑒𝑅ℎitalic-C italic-e italic-R italic-hCeRh and C⁢e⁢P⁢d𝐶𝑒𝑃𝑑italic-C italic-e italic-P italic-dCePd, we take the same volume per atom as in CrB in order to be able to compare the outcoming magnetic properties.

From Table II we see that the CsCl structure favours magnetism, even if slightly, as compared to the CrB one. This is a consequence of CsCl having higher symmetry. Crystal field effects lead, in the CrB case, to a lifting of almost all of the 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f degeneracies while this is not the case in the CsCl structure. Within a ’quasi’-Stoner image CsCl favours magnetism due to a higher density of states at the Fermi level. This is coherent with the fact that only some of the CrB compounds are magnetic while all of the CsCl ones are magnetic.

Figure 3 shows charge density plots with contributions stemming from the energy range 0.7⁢EF<E<EF0.7subscript𝐸𝐹𝐸subscript𝐸𝐹NUMBER:0.7 italic-E POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-F POSTSUBSCRIPT:end RELOP:less-than italic-E RELOP:less-than italic-E POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-F POSTSUBSCRIPT:end0.7E_{F}<E<E_{F}, where EFsubscript𝐸𝐹italic-E POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-F POSTSUBSCRIPT:endE_{F} is the Fermi energy. In this range the 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f band is the most important one. The plots show, for the C⁢e⁢R⁢h𝐶𝑒𝑅ℎitalic-C italic-e italic-R italic-hCeRh system, the charge densities projected into the (010) plane for CrB and into the (110) one for CsCl. In the CrB structure the 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f-4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f hybridization between neighboring C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe sites is more important than the 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f-4⁢d4𝑑NUMBER:4 italic-d4d or 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f-3⁢d3𝑑NUMBER:3 italic-d3d hybridization between C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe and TM atoms. This can be infered from the fact that there is more charge between C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe atoms than between C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe and TM, namely a weight of 0.02 in CrB as compared to 0.007 in CsCl. On the other hand, the 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f-d𝑑italic-dd hybridization is stronger in CsCl than in CrB. The amount of total interstitial charge is practically the same in both structures: CrB and CsCl structures have 4.4 and 4.3 interstitial electrons per formula unit respectively. The difference among them comes from the spatial distribution of charge.

For the systems under study which crystallize in the CsCl structure, symmetry makes a contribution to the magnetic moment of C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe, but it is actually not the crystalline environment the determining factor for the magnetic behavior. It is rather the chemical nature of the ligands the one that is responsible for this magnetic result. Considering for instance, the C⁢e⁢A⁢g𝐶𝑒𝐴𝑔italic-C italic-e italic-A italic-gCeAg or C⁢e⁢C⁢d𝐶𝑒𝐶𝑑italic-C italic-e italic-C italic-dCeCd system from the previous section, which crystallize in the CsCl structure, the 4d band lies very low in energy and thereafter there is nearly no hybridization betwen 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f-4⁢d4𝑑NUMBER:4 italic-d4d bands, leading this to the magnetization of Ce. In the hypothetical situation that one could force these systems to crystallize in the CrB structure they would also be magnetic.

On the other hand, if we compare the magnetization of C⁢e⁢N⁢i𝐶𝑒𝑁𝑖italic-C italic-e italic-N italic-iCeNi, C⁢e⁢R⁢h𝐶𝑒𝑅ℎitalic-C italic-e italic-R italic-hCeRh and C⁢e⁢P⁢d𝐶𝑒𝑃𝑑italic-C italic-e italic-P italic-dCePd focusing on the CrB structure, which is the real one for these compounds, we can get insight into the effect that the type of ligand has on the magnetic moment of C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe. Using our criterion C⁢e⁢P⁢d𝐶𝑒𝑃𝑑italic-C italic-e italic-P italic-dCePd is a magnetically ordered system, while C⁢e⁢R⁢h𝐶𝑒𝑅ℎitalic-C italic-e italic-R italic-hCeRh and C⁢e⁢N⁢i𝐶𝑒𝑁𝑖italic-C italic-e italic-N italic-iCeNi are not when considered in their natural CrB structure. In Figure 4 we show the densities of states for the three compounds. The different magnetic solutions within the same crystalline structure can be explained, by the fact that in C⁢e⁢R⁢h𝐶𝑒𝑅ℎitalic-C italic-e italic-R italic-hCeRh the 4⁢d4𝑑NUMBER:4 italic-d4d band is closer in energy to the Fermi level than in the P⁢d𝑃𝑑italic-P italic-dPd compound and consequently 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f-4⁢d4𝑑NUMBER:4 italic-d4d hybridization is stronger. The more the 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f band hybridizes with the 4⁢d4𝑑NUMBER:4 italic-d4d band the smaller is the C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe magnetic moment. On the other hand, in the C⁢e⁢N⁢i𝐶𝑒𝑁𝑖italic-C italic-e italic-N italic-iCeNi case, there is an interplay between two types of hybridization namely C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe-C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe and C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe-N⁢i𝑁𝑖italic-N italic-iNi, both induce a decrease of the magnetism of Ce as compared to C⁢e⁢P⁢d𝐶𝑒𝑃𝑑italic-C italic-e italic-P italic-dCePd. Actually, in C⁢e⁢N⁢i𝐶𝑒𝑁𝑖italic-C italic-e italic-N italic-iCeNi, there is a reduction in volume and C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe atoms are nearer to each other than in CePd. Consequently, as can be seen from the densities of states in Figure 4, the 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f band is 0.5 eV wider in C⁢e⁢N⁢i𝐶𝑒𝑁𝑖italic-C italic-e italic-N italic-iCeNi than in C⁢e⁢P⁢d𝐶𝑒𝑃𝑑italic-C italic-e italic-P italic-dCePd due to an increase in C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe-C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe mixing. On the other side, the 3⁢d3𝑑NUMBER:3 italic-d3d band lies nearer to EFsubscript𝐸𝐹italic-E POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-F POSTSUBSCRIPT:endE_{F} than the 4⁢d4𝑑NUMBER:4 italic-d4d one this giving rise to 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f-3⁢d3𝑑NUMBER:3 italic-d3d mixing. Due to this interplay C⁢e⁢N⁢i𝐶𝑒𝑁𝑖italic-C italic-e italic-N italic-iCeNi is the less magnetic compound among the CrB systems.

In this contribution using an itinerant picture we show that it is possible to characterize the magnetic ground state of C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe intermetallic compounds by doing ab-initio calculations within the LDA approximation. This criterion allows us to classify them into magnetically ordered, intermediate valence or paramagnetic systems trough their calculated spin contributions to the C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe magnetic moment. It is based on the band theory frame in which, in general, correlated C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe systems are not well described. However we find that it is an usefull tool to obtaine qualitative information about the electronic ground state of a wide variety of C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe compounds, including those with strong electronic correlations.

We study the importance of 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f hybridization in determining the magnetic state of C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe by analysing both symmetry and chemical effects. We study first the influence of the symmetry environment on 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f hybridization in C⁢e⁢N⁢i𝐶𝑒𝑁𝑖italic-C italic-e italic-N italic-iCeNi, C⁢e⁢R⁢h𝐶𝑒𝑅ℎitalic-C italic-e italic-R italic-hCeRh and C⁢e⁢P⁢d𝐶𝑒𝑃𝑑italic-C italic-e italic-P italic-dCePd and take CsCl and CrB as prototypes of high and low symmetry structures. We see that CsCl slightly favour magnetism as compared to CrB. This fact can be understood with the following argument: CrB’s local environment has less symmetry operations than CsCl (8 vs. 48) and consequently there is a lifting of 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f degeneracies giving rise to a smaller density of states at the Fermi energy. Within a Stoner picture there is a stronger instability for magnetism in CsCl than in CrB. In this sense we can understand the fact that all the systems with the formula unit CeX are magnetic when growing in the CsCl structure (with X belonging to the 1B, 2B and 3A column of the periodic table) but they are not when growing in the CrB, in which only C⁢e⁢P⁢d𝐶𝑒𝑃𝑑italic-C italic-e italic-P italic-dCePd and C⁢e⁢P⁢t𝐶𝑒𝑃𝑡italic-C italic-e italic-P italic-tCePt are magnetically ordered.

Noteworthy is the fact that, in the cases studied, local symmetry is not a determining factor for the magnetic behavior. It is actually the type of ligand the crucial factor to determine the magnetic state. Along this line, we focus our study on the CrB structure to analyse the effect of chemical environment. We conclude that both 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f-d𝑑italic-dd and 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f-4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f types of hybridization can lead to a decrease of C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe magnetic moment in the systems C⁢e⁢R⁢h𝐶𝑒𝑅ℎitalic-C italic-e italic-R italic-hCeRh and C⁢e⁢N⁢i𝐶𝑒𝑁𝑖italic-C italic-e italic-N italic-iCeNi with respect to C⁢e⁢P⁢d𝐶𝑒𝑃𝑑italic-C italic-e italic-P italic-dCePd. In the first case it is mainly the mixing between the 4⁢d4𝑑NUMBER:4 italic-d4d band of R⁢h𝑅ℎitalic-R italic-hRh with the 4⁢f4𝑓NUMBER:4 italic-f4f one from C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe what produces a strong decrease in the magnetic moment. In the second case, C⁢e⁢N⁢i𝐶𝑒𝑁𝑖italic-C italic-e italic-N italic-iCeNi, both types of hybridization occur, resulting this in an even lower value of the magnetic moment of C⁢e𝐶𝑒italic-C italic-eCe.
